website_summaries.verdict: This model offers sound and bass quality comparable to similar models with good comfort over short periods, making this a good option for users who do not need a set to use for long periods.
pros: Decibel level compares to similar JVC models
Sound quality matches that of some higher priced models
The padding on these headphones is not quite as thick as on some other models, but it is adequately comfortable for shorter periods of time
The adjustable headband is durable and fits the desired size of most users
cons: The high-quality bass reproduction on this model can tend to overwhelm the mids and treble on some types of music

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound, uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to upgrade a $5 pair of heaphones I got at a discount store which I use to listen to music (and block out people talking) at work. After a week of using these JVCs, I went back to my old ones. The sound quality is terrible on these. Muddy, vocals are buried, but bass is also weak. Some other reviews say they sound decent with an amp, but I'm not going to spend the money to find out. Another problem with these is comfort. They seem comfortable at first, but the hard plastic over the speakers pushes against my ears and eventually causes soreness. They are very plasticy and feel flimsy. I don't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kish

customer_reviews.title: Surprised how good these headphones are!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these headphones. Perfect balance with the bass. If you have a thick case on your phone you'll need an extended but, besides that? Perfect. Very nice padding. Very comfortable Added a couple photos to show how much padding there is
customer_reviews.author: Christina North

customer_reviews.title: just what we were looking for
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for headphones for my tv that I could use while my girlfriend could be in the same room doing school work. I thought they would be easy to find, but I saw that many were extremely expensive. Of the more modestly priced options, one was wireless and kept emitting white noise whenever I moved my head in certain directions, and another had a cord but I could not increase the volume above a whisper. Then I found these JVC headphones. They are comfortable, perfectly loud, and a great price. I've recommended to several of my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Not for Me
customer_reviews.text: I Really wanted to like these Headphones because the Quality seemed good and I Like JVC....But.....I thought maybe these had a Mute Switch somewhere because at Full Volume all I Got was Bass which I like.I Compared with my other Ear on Headphones including a JVC Pair and had to turn them down as is usually the case.Oh Well I'm on my way to UPS to Return.Maybe nextime.Thank goodness for Amazons return Policy.
customer_reviews.author: Charlane Valade

customer_reviews.title: OK for price but....
customer_reviews.text: I bought these several months ago for a secondary monitoring application. For that purpose they were a good value. The point was to check recorded content against scripts. Nice and clear; comfortable to use for long periods. BUT then I had need to do some quality control using them. Not good. Far too much bass response; little mid-range and almost no highs. I'll keep them for the original use but will be ordering a pair of AKG's (I have others by them) for the more critical use.
customer_reviews.author: rfn

customer_reviews.title: Package Was Opened and Re-Taped! UGH
customer_reviews.text: These are not new!!!! I just took this out of the shipping box to wrap for Christmas and noticed that this has been opened and re-taped! It looks awful and is not what was advertised. This is HORRIBLE!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly P.

customer_reviews.title: Worked Fine Until the Tip Broke Off
customer_reviews.text: My daughter used these for 4 months, 1 day per week for about 1 hour each time at school. She brought them home the other day and said the tip broke off. You can barely tell the headphones were used at all, but now they are useless because the tip is broken off and they no longer work. I cannot find any information regarding a warranty on Amazon or the JVC website.
customer_reviews.author: James Eric Mushrush

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound for the price.
customer_reviews.text: These sound pretty good for the price. My daughter uses these when she's playing her electric piano and is quite satisfied with them. if you don't expect Bose quality for under twenty bucks, then I think you won't be disappointed. They also have held up pretty well she hasn't broken the 3.5 connector yet. Without boring you with a detailed audio analysis, which I feel is useless for a pair of $20 headphones, I will say that they sound decently full and rich for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dino002

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: headphones are full sized. Decent sound quality. works well for intended purpose of plugging into an electronic piano. Covers my ears with no pressure on them. Small pads keep the piece that goes over the top of my head comfortable. Only concern is it has a relatively small diameter cable that does not give me confidence in its durability. My old sony headphones had durability issues with the ear pads. So much so that there are many aftermarket replacements available. I do not see any such earpad replacements for this headphone so I hope they do not break down too quickly.
customer_reviews.author: GHMINI

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value/Steal!
customer_reviews.text: I am truly surprised and impressed. Such great quality sound at such a low price. These are isolation headphones nor are they noise-cancelling headphones. They do provide very good sound barriers which enable the music to come through with ultra clarity. The bass is truly definitive with these headphones. I would definitely say these are studio quality headphones and though they may not cost $100 or more, don't let the price fool you. I have some on-ear studio headphones and these surpass their sound quality by a mile. I use these with my KAT3 drums and I am just blown away.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Dotson

customer_reviews.title: JUNK!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was the worst sounding pair of headphones I’ve ever listened to. The sound is totally muffled with no clear sound at all. DON’T BUY THESE unless you have $10 to lose. I couldn’t send them back because they were part of the $25 free deal. Amazon should not carry these when they sound so bad. WASTE OF MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely dreadful. Stay away!
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box, the audio was muddy, muffled, and way too bass-y. Even after playing with the sound settings and equalizer, I could barely get it to "passable." On top of that it's uncomfortable to wear, and does absolutely nothing to block out ambient sound. Stay far, far away from these. There's a reason they're so cheap.
customer_reviews.author: mike r

customer_reviews.title: Good for casual listening
customer_reviews.text: The audio quality is not what you call "out of this world" is good for simple stuff. The build quality is also average, all plastic, is good thu. The foam of the ear pads will peel eventually since it has that sticky cover, is also hot not recommended for long sessions. Finally the top of the band doesn't have any kind of cushioning so is hard to wear sometimes. There is also the cable, is very long so it could be a good point or a bad one. In my case I need a unit with a long cable but it could be a little inconvenient for some people.
customer_reviews.author: Abe

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality on these is ok, but there is a lot of outside sound getting in. They get uncomfortable the longer you use them And not just at one time that lack of padding is harsh after a while. The big thing for me is that the wires leading into them are very flimsy and worrisome and this does NOT come with the tangle free cord advertised. The lines come from the headphones to a y and run joined in a 2 line flat cable. Also not of real quality. They tangle often and I constantly worry them getting pulled from the cups. They didn't even re-enforce that spot. I would not recommend or buy these again
customer_reviews.author: Michael D Barclay

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the price.
customer_reviews.text: They are very different than my Sony dynamic stereo headphones. First these cover the ears completely and the sound of music sounded far away to me. Volume was okay as I wore them longer my ears got used to it and adapted. If I go back to my Sony though there is still that sound distinction. I only got these because after 8 years my Sony headphone cord was not working in my computer. The music would go in and out and sometimes only play in one earpeice. Not a lot of bass in these like the Sony's either. But they will do for now.
customer_reviews.author: poprocks50

customer_reviews.title: Very poor audio, but comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I go through many cheap headphones in my work and these are by far the worst-sounding I have owned in many years. The entire sound is faintly muffled with excess bass. Also, it may be relevant to you or not, but the plug is a bit bulky and won't fit into most phones that have cases on them. I can't judge it TOO harshly because it is still very low-priced and lightweight enough that it doesn't bother the ears, but these are my least-favorite headphones and I don't recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: GEORGE

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic headphones - I'll keep buying them as long as I can!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic headphones! Well, that is, if you like the kind of headphone that covers your entire ear like I do. I've been using my first set for nearly two years of daily use and now the pseudo-leather on the earmuffs is finally starting to look old. My wife kept stealing my set, so I bought her one as well. They're super-comfortable, and the muffs are large enough to completely cover my ears and block out most noise. Sound quality is also great, with no degradation so far after two years. Mostly used for gaming but I also deal with a lot movies and music.
customer_reviews.author: Omegacron

customer_reviews.title: Great set of headphones for casual use (TV, music)
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these JVC headphones for well over 10 years now. After I wear a pair out (usually after about 2 to 3 years of use), I buy another pair. Comfortable on my ears (which are bigger than average) and the long cord makes it great for hooking up to a TV (such as in bedroom). One thing they need to improve is the top of head comfort pads, they are too small and fall off easily. Also these are not noise canceling headphones so don't expect that feature. The Bass is deep and rich and great with all genres of music.
customer_reviews.author: David Rambo

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones
customer_reviews.text: Good quality headphones, I've ordered several pairs over the years (bought the first set seven years ago), they last quite long and can handle a drop. Keep in mind that after three or four years the outside of the ear cushioning will start flaking, but you can remove the flakes and reveal the fabric underneath and continue using the headphones just fine. The only reason I occasionally have to replace them was due to serious mishandling on my end (like yanking the cord while plugged in or dropping them over and over).
customer_reviews.author: Adonai Elohim

customer_reviews.title: They're pretty good
customer_reviews.text: The noise cancellation doesn't really work very well. I can hear everything going on around me pretty well even when I turn up the volume. It's like when you go to the movies but you can still hear people talking a few rows ahead/behind you. It dulls the noise a little but it doesn't cancel it out. The sound is crisp and nice though. The headphones are also very comfortable. The cord is incredibly long. I had to tie it up just to keep it from getting caught on anything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace a pricier set of headphones that I use to listen to music at work. I'm very glad I decided on these. While they are bulky, they are surprisingly lightweight and comfortable. They don't put pressure on your ears like some. I LOVE that they only have a cord on one side and not both. Noise cancellation is minimal but sound is very decent quality. You can't beat this quality at this price point. Great set for casual, and comfortable, listening.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley G

customer_reviews.title: Works for me.
customer_reviews.text: Almost all my music listening is when I'm pumping iron or on the treadmill or exercise bike with hyper-aggressive death metal putting me in the right mood for a good workout. The fact that this headphone is a little muddy in music quality is irrelevant for my purposes and I can adjust my device's equalizer to my satisfaction. This headphone fits snug and comfortable for me. Overall, this was a very good value purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Saturn61

customer_reviews.title: Worst sound ever
customer_reviews.text: Worst sound ever. Amazing you can find headphones that sound this bad and muffled. No mid tones. No high tones. Just muffled bass. Like listening to headphones underwater. I bought a different pair for $7 on Amazon and they sound 10 times better. In the end, I peeled off the foam cups and put them on an old pair for more comfort. The rest went in the trash. Reviews deceiving.
customer_reviews.author: Zon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: I loved these headphones when they first arrived
customer_reviews.text: I loved these headphones when they first arrived. They were for my 9 year okd daughter and she was over the moon for them. Unfortunately she attempted to plug them into her tablet and the end snapped off cause it to get stuck in the tablet headphone jack. This set off a chain reaction causing no volume on the tablet because it recognizes the phone jack having the phones “plugged in.” Thankful I have a 2 year no hassle warranty on the tablet and can send it in for repair or replacement. I am extremely disappointed in the quality of these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Delaney

customer_reviews.title: Wife likes them!
customer_reviews.text: That's all that matters to me. She's happy, I'm happy. Seriously though, she says the noise cancellation is great and I don't have to turn the TV down so she can hear. Says the quality of sound is good and they are comfortable for her. Dano
customer_reviews.author: Dano

customer_reviews.title: Sufficient for the price
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is decent, but when you do a side by side test, these aren't as good as others. Feels cheaply built, but the price is reflected in that. I wouldn't buy them for someone (like a kid) like doesn't take care of their things because they will likely break quickly. I have minimal use though and don't throw them around so they are sufficient. There is no top of the head padding, so that is annoying and hurts after a while. Probably the best part is that they don't push too hard on my eyeglasses and hurt my head.
customer_reviews.author: msSera

customer_reviews.title: Questionable quality
customer_reviews.text: I used to be able to find cheap corded head phones all over the place. I use them for yard work only. They sound great when the connector is not moving causing static. Yes, it came with a bad plug. Fail. I will be throwing these away in the very near future.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Larrew

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic sound and quality
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these headphones. They look bulky, but they are quite light and powerful. I tested the sound on my MP3 player, home stereo, desktop and laptop computers and they constantly delivered the booming bass sound I love. Plus they were just as remarkable with my old Sony Walkman, which i still use to play cassettes. Technology may change, but their still is nothing like a good mix tape from the 1980's.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Whiteside

customer_reviews.title: lasted about a week or two short of the 1 year mark - short in wire
customer_reviews.text: I thought these were amazing and had good sound quality. I don't normally leave reviews but it lasted just about a year. By the time I got around to looking up my order and doing the warranty I'm literally two days past the warranty. I bought these thinking they were higher quality and they seem that way but they just don't hold up to everyday use. Your mileage may vary but I'm looking for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: consumer767464

customer_reviews.title: For 13$ it is quite good. Maybe because I am quite new to over ...
customer_reviews.text: For 13$ it is quite good. Maybe because I am quite new to over ear headphone and used to the parasonic 7$ inear. I hate it how when i take the headphone off I can hear sounds coming from it and ppl can hear hence why i chose overear but that is not happening. When I play music, I have to turn volume high to be able to hear the voices and instruments otherwise it sounds muddle and distance. I’m satisfied with the bass. Another minor flaw is the headphone jack would not fit/snap in place to the phone jack, constantly slipping out when you pull on it.
customer_reviews.author: Ani Chen

customer_reviews.title: Only has the mini 1/8" plug
customer_reviews.text: My plan was to use these to monitor myself as I record my podcast. My Mic amp box has a plug for 1/4" headphone jack. Since there was no mention of what size there was on the packaging, I did not include an adapter in my order. Yeah, partly my mistake, but the lack of that information in the details of the listing, or in the product packaging is a huge misstep. Other headphones came with an adapter (or so it showed in their listings).
customer_reviews.author: Son of a Librarian

customer_reviews.title: Pure junk
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. These were very inexpensive for a reason, they're junk. The ear pads do NOT conform to the ear. They do NOT cancel any background noise. Do NOT waste your money on these imitation earphones.
customer_reviews.author: Lab Rat

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, high quality item.
customer_reviews.text: These over the ear phones are not noise cancelling, but they have a strong range of frequencies and are comfortable to wear. The cord is VERY long, which can be a plus or a minus, depending on needs. These headphones do not have a volume control, which is not a big deal to us. If you are looking for strong performance with a small price, this is one you may like.
customer_reviews.author: M. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy in this price range.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know what to expect for 13.99, but am pleasantly surprised. The top headpiece is molded plastic, but adjustable and with reasonable care should suffice. The earphones fit over my ears, are comfortable, and shut out most outside noise. The cord seems substantial, and is plenty long. I'm listening to old jazz right now on Amazon Music and the sound quality is adequate for what I llisten too. I don't think you could do better in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Yellowkid

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality is just not here!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones come with an 8 foot cord! They fit nicely over the ears. That being said the sound quality is lacking. I cannot even enjoy a You Tube Video! It is hard to understand peoples voices. NETFLIX is not enjoyable any more. I should not have to strain to hear what people are saying! I would have been better off going to Walmart and trying a cheap pair there! I did not expect a high quality sound but these are really substandard!
customer_reviews.author: kenneth r. woolard jr.

customer_reviews.title: Are you sure you want this much cord?
customer_reviews.text: These held up to more than two years of heavy use before the connector failed at the plug end. Very light and comfortable. I've fallen asleep while wearing these, which I probably shouldn't do because I'm afraid I'll roll over and break them, but so far, they're very good at staying in place and holding their shape. Good clear sound. The long cord gives me a lot of freedom of movement, though I do have to babysit it when I wear them in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi Sutton

customer_reviews.title: They sound fine but do start to hurt after while when wearing ...
customer_reviews.text: They sound fine but do start to hurt after while when wearing glasses. I'm not sure anything can be done about that. I knocked one star off because they don't block any noise whatsoever. I got them for work and any blocking of noise has to come from the music. But they are cheap, and a nice long cord, which was much more handy than I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Wilbur

customer_reviews.title: JVC is declining and failing to improve.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. Very lightweight. Not what I was wanting. Bought with hopes of a decent, affordable studio monitor. Fail. Thinly made. Sound quality is poor. 1 star was generous there. Not described as sound isolation, but, these have zero. You can hear most all surrounding sounds. I gave them away.
customer_reviews.author: Robert I.

customer_reviews.title: good sound quality for voices on tv.
customer_reviews.text: I generally find that for listening to voices over the tv, that the cheaper ear phones work better. I had damaged my previous JVC earphones, and did not pay enough attention to ordering these. All the voice quality was good, but I found the all encompassing ear pads however made my ears hot and sweaty. I can probably wear them during the winter time, but I think I'll keep looking for those other jvc phones. Obviously, I did not buy for music.
customer_reviews.author: michael williams

customer_reviews.title: After two days devloped a loose connection ... moving the plug results in crackles.
customer_reviews.text: Without equalization sounds is poor, but use an equalizer (like the one in iTunes) and these headphone are not bad for $15. If you have average size ears, the space in the cans might squeeze them a bit. After two days devloped a loose connection ... moving the plug results in crackles. (Computer is new)
customer_reviews.author: Hidden

customer_reviews.title: I really love the quality of sound these stereo headphones offer
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the JVC Extra Bass Stereo Headphones HA-RX300. Its features include a large 40 mm driver unit, direct sound delivery system, twist action structure, 5 anti resonance structure for clear sound, and single sided 2.5 m cord. I really love the quality of sound these stereo headphones offer. I am a music lover, and it is important that I'm able to hear the instruments clearly and intensely. I really appreciate the bass boost that aids in sound quality. Also the stereo sound helps to make my meditation CDs more effective. I've noticed that other headphones that offer stereo and higher quality sound are often more expensive, especially with the popularity in gaming. These headphones, however, are very affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Larecia

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, good sound; feels like a cheap build; really large
customer_reviews.text: Boy, are these big. I understand they are advertised as full size...pay attention to that. Don't plan on traveling with them. For home use: great sound and comfort for a cheap set. They have a quite-long heavy-duty cord...maybe a bit too long. The overall build feels cheap. A fine deal, overall.
customer_reviews.author: I. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical buying cheaper headphones. Pleased with these. The driver gives surprisingly good bass which was one of my concerns. Overall sound is good and they are lightweight/comfortable. My only concern is the material that surrounds the ear. Time will tell but I fear it will wear out at some point. Cord is adequate. For the price I don't think you can do better.
customer_reviews.author: jdubs

customer_reviews.title: Tells me that they sound great, but I could tell that what she liked ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for my girlfriend for air travel. She loves them. Tells me that they sound great, but I could tell that what she liked most was the fit of the "over the ear" design of these. She wore them for the flight movies and for sleeping. the comfort was great for both and so was the suppression of outside noise. I got a pair of "OBiDi - Airplane Travel Headphone Audio Jacks" and attached them - necessary for four of the six flights she has used them on so far. Like the Behringer set I bought for myself, the only down side was their inability to fols, so they were bulky in the carry-on.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Cal

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: With my previous pair of cheap JVC headphones, you could swivel the headphones themselves to better fit over your ears. These are fixed in place, and the band is very uncomfortable. Unfortunately I can’t move the band around without moving the headphones away from my ears and lowering the sound quality. Will probably return them.
customer_reviews.author: W.D. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Excelent Quality both in how well is made and sound quality. It provides a good length connector, that is light in weight. Very well priced for the good quality of the product. It provides good isolation from external noise even though there is no active noise cancellation. The headphones are not heavy, which make them suitable for wearing at long intervals There is no microphone so they are not suitable for interactive gaming or answering telephone calls.
customer_reviews.author: Emotive Pen

customer_reviews.title: super long cord, good sound quality, bulky (obviously)
customer_reviews.text: really great! i love these. i’m 5’0” tall tho, and this cord is sooooo long it drags on the ground lol. i just wind it up and put the excess cord in my pocket. they’re also a bit bulky and awkward when worn around the neck, but i don’t mind. definitely satisfied with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price. Not suited for power mower use.
customer_reviews.text: These fit over the ear and are fairly substantial. I purchased this based upon other reviews indicated they used these while mowing (one indicated use with a zero-turn rider). While you can hear through these phones while mowing, they do not block out the noise from the mower well enough, and the volume of your device needs to be turned up quite high to override the mower noise. Prolonged use at such a volume could cause hearing loss, so I would not recommend these be used with a power mower. I found them to be quite comfortable and not too tight for my head (hat size 7.5), and the sound clarity is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Returning Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Impressive! Most impressive.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful pair of headphones! They help suppress outer noise pretty darn well; sound quality is excellent. Highly recommend these headphones. Oh, and SUPER comfortable to wear; it’s like wearing a cloud over your ears. These are honestly the most comfortable I’ve ever worn personally. Get these, have a good price that won’t break the bank.😎
customer_reviews.author: StarWars66

customer_reviews.title: I have a big head
customer_reviews.text: I found these headphones to be large, but not large enough. They were fairly uncomfortable from the pressure and I couldn't take wearing them for long periods. I found a solution though. I put the headphones on an object larger than my head and used a heat gun (hair dryer might work too) to gently warm up the plastic piece at the top, reducing the curvature just a bit. They fit perfectly now.
customer_reviews.author: Setrict

customer_reviews.title: These are AWESOME. no pressure on your head
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually write reviews, but I just had to for this product. My ears always start hurting when I wear headphones. I don't know if they are extra sensitive, but putting buds in my ear makes them ache, and the ones that go over my head usually press so hard on my head that I get a headache. These are AWESOME. no pressure on your head, but they stay on very well. No irritation to the ears at all. And they sound pretty good. It's almost like you don't have any headphones on at all when you are wearing them. I literally forget they are on. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Clarapalooza

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice as far as sound quality goes. Not as comfortable as the HARX 900s
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality headphones. The padding on the top isn't really sufficient to remain comfortable but that was also straight out of the box without me getting used to them. Good quality connector and the swiveling feature on the ear cups is enjoyed. Very nice and clear bass as well as high ranges. A solid pair of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Colby Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good quality sound, cable could be longer
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. No static, hisses or other issues like my wireless ones. The only problem is it tethers me, but that's a small price to pay for the much better sound quality. My only problem: the cord needs to be about 3 feet longer so I could sit on my couch. I bought an extender though and now can use my headphones AND sit on my furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Old school style
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy the over the ear headphone and these are no exception. Plenty of room so it does press on my ear and the over sound quality is decent for the money. The cable is rather long which is nice for working in the office, but it can trip you up.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Decent Product Cecent price
customer_reviews.text: They are fairly comfortable and the sound isnt bad! I do THink jumping in price by 1/3 in a 2 month period is a little much. But overall a decent product If it dies or breaks in the next few months I will Update but so far I am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: lharchmage

customer_reviews.title: Lots of bass in these. Not optimal for a wide range of music
customer_reviews.text: Liked the fit and finish for the price. But I listen to a wide range of music styles. Too much bass inherent for all but Rap,Hip-Hop,ect. Good loudness..Just not for me. If you're used to studio monitor grade headsets you will probably not like these.
customer_reviews.author: IBZANE

customer_reviews.title: They're Ok
customer_reviews.text: I needed some new headphones since my Sony ones have lost all of the soft leather-like covering. (They still work great, just look bad.) I tried these JVC ones and the sound quality is not nearly as good. They are fine for narration and videos, but my old ones are so much better for music.
customer_reviews.author: ATLmom1234

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this a few years ago. Used only a few times when my wife is sleeping and I want to watch Tv. The material; around the ear pieces disintegrated . Suggest you try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD F.

customer_reviews.title: Jvc good product..just not durable for kids...
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the product the sound was great and the bass was booming but it wasn't intended for children under 10 yes of age..usually children's headphones suck said my son..so I got him these JVC's but they didn't even last him a month..Still a good product but not a really durable product...for adults only product...
customer_reviews.author: Christopher S. Cluney-Telepath

customer_reviews.title: Got my money's worth
customer_reviews.text: For less than $10, these performed well until the plastic connection on the right side broke. From purchase date to end of life: 3 years 9 months 18 days. I found these to be comfortable for up to a couple of hours at a time. No squeezing on the ears. The lack of padding for the top of your head can lead to fatigue. Overall sound quality was acceptable for my listening habits - podcasts with occasional ambient background music. Will be looking for a higher end, and more durable replacement, but I really cannot complain for the price.
customer_reviews.author: D. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Sound is good for the price. NOT FOR PEOPLE WITH BIG EARS!!!
customer_reviews.text: The sound and build quality is good for the price. These are supposed to be full sized and should cover large ears. My ears are fairly large but not huge. Never the less, the ear cups are way to small all the way around. If anyone has a good recommendation for over the ear headphones for people with big ears. Please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wells

customer_reviews.title: No Sound from Left Speaker Only After 4 Months
customer_reviews.text: Left speaker stop producing sounds after 3 months of light use. I trust JVC headphones from my experience in the past but I guess I was unlucky and received a defective one.
customer_reviews.author: box2com

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, superb volume,  and economical
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable and have good volume. They don't "leak" sound to the people around you. I use them in bed with a laptop nearby to watch things at night and also for sleep sounds. These are well worth the extra few dollars over the super cheap alternatives while still being economical. All the dollar store ones I have purchased have broken or fallen apart within days.
customer_reviews.author: BrokeDad

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought a Yamaha piano and I recently bought these headphones To go along with it when I plug them into my piano the grand piano sound quality is intense great noise cancellation very very impressed! Amazing headphones at an excellent price! The lengthy cord works out perfect in conjunction with where the headphone jack on my piano is needed the extra length.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Sounded great, but vinyl cups started falling into tiny pieces after a year of use
customer_reviews.text: I had to stop using these when tiny flakes of vinyl started falling on EVERYTHING. My clothes, my hair, on my face, etc. Who knows if I've ingested a flake or two as well. Anyway, great sound, but since there are no ear cup replacements anywhere, I went with a Sony 7506 since they do have replacement pads. I thought JVC was known for their modest but great quality.
customer_reviews.author: LincolnRider

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad purchase for under $15
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad purchase for under $15. That being said... Pros: - Light. They're comfortable enough to wear for hours and hours. - Having both earcups twist and turn make for a comfortable fit too. - The sound quality is very good especially for the price. - A dynamic range of 12Hz-22KHz gives some real nice lows and mids (bass and treble). - Comes with a long cord at 8.20 feet (2.5 meters). - Also comes with a 3.5mm to 1/4" (6.3mm) adapter. Cons: - These headphones aren't as loud as I'd like them to be. That's about it. :) Remember, for the price, I believe it's a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jabberwock

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to listen to my TV while riding my loud stationary bike. They fit great, have very good sound, and are comfortable. I love the extra long cord. As a bonus, now my son can watch his TV programs in the same room while I'm reading and there is no distraction. I love these headphones and definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: AVOID
customer_reviews.text: Painful headphones, double wires, poor sound, at least get the single wire version, avoid these.
customer_reviews.author: R. H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: We got these headphones to use with our kitchen t.v. for when we do dishes or need to listen to the t.v. surreptitiously. The cord length is perfect for our purposes, and it's a pretty strong cord. A reinforced cord would theoretically be better, but this works fine, and the headphones sound and feel great. Highly recommend. Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Very good headphones for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very good headphones for the price. I needed a long cord and these have it. The sound is adequate for the job. The are really light weight and don't smash my head like some headphones do. They arrived on time and well packaged with no damage. Overall very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Bad.
customer_reviews.text: I know these are cheap but... they don't even get loud. The Panasonic earbuds work so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Khadijah.

customer_reviews.title: If you want to use them more than a few times save your $
customer_reviews.text: I wanted these because of the long cord. Used them about two dozen times and now the sound only works in one ear and the other side has a very loud buzzing - makes them completely unusable. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great sound! Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I have chosen to use these during my radio show, because they are so comfortable, so I can really only talk about voices, not music. The voices are clear, clean, and rich. The headphones are extremely comfortable to wear for long periods of time, since they fit fully over my years and don't press on them or my glasses. I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Francesco

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are just fine. I am not an audio junkie or a music professional. I'm just a guy who spends a lot of time working at a computer in a very noisy environment. While playing music through these headphones the background noise does not disappear, but is lowered significantly. These headphones unfortunately do feel a little fragile compared to more expensive ones, but I am not very rough with them. Considering that I got them for about $20 I certainly cannot complain! As far as audio quality is concerned, I am very content. I definitely cannot tell the difference between these headphones and my friend's $200+ pair of headphones, which is great for me!
customer_reviews.author: Zach G

customer_reviews.title: Low cost but acceptable quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use with an IPAD. Sound is not as good of quality as SOLOs or Bose but better than the cheaper Panasonic headphones I was using. The phones are low cost and fit well . They are good value for the money. Not noise cancelling but that was not a feature I wanted. Can hear the phone when wearing these.
customer_reviews.author: Curdog

customer_reviews.title: Really great sound on a budget. Almost studio quality.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are freaking awesome; buy them NOW!!! - - I mean, they're not professional onstage or recording studio (reference-professional) quality, like the AKGs or Sennheisers and the like are (although I've used and seen them used in both the studio and onstage). - - But if you've got a kickass home surround-sound system that sounds best when it's cranked up loud enough to just about break your beer mug... comparably, even though this headset isn't surround sound, you won't be at all disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: M. Donehoo

customer_reviews.title: Just received and they sound great
customer_reviews.text: I just received the head phones and they are great for what I need. The sound is good and I love that they have a long cord that allows me to get up and do things when required. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Ken James

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap-ish headphones
customer_reviews.text: They are larger than I had anticipated them being, with a somewhat long cord. The headphones are good, not top of the line good, but good for the price. They seem to holding up well. The only con is that they wouldn’t fit in the headphone jack of an iPhone with an Otterbox Defender case on.
customer_reviews.author: Aurora Cosmos

customer_reviews.title: Pushes on the outside of my ear, just a little.
customer_reviews.text: My only disappointment is that the hardware pushes on the outside of my ear, just a little. Wearing them for a short. Of time is no problem, but for a longer it creates some discomfort. I still bought 10 of these for my classroom. Waiting to see how long they last, used by 150 middle schoolers!
customer_reviews.author: MrComp

customer_reviews.title: Ace of Base!
customer_reviews.text: I need a corded headset because my telephone needs the cord to make the antenna for the radio work. Cord was plenty long enough to make a great antenna. For this low price it has great sound quality including Mega Bass!
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good sound short lifespan 1 month
customer_reviews.text: Only worked for 3 weeks then noting while they were working they were awesome but they stopped working and I did not treat them rough just as monterining head phones spend more and get something work your money and JVC put more effort and these could be much better
customer_reviews.author: andrew owens

customer_reviews.title: sounds like dog dookie
customer_reviews.text: just opened. bass baffling, treble tinny. it is horrible. on low volume so no distortion! also calling my old boss at the ftc. this is fraud
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Stephenson

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre sound at best with overbearing bass
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to go with my laptop. I'd say you get what you pay for with these. I have turtle beach z11's that I got for around $18 and they're MUCH clearer than these. I'd stay away unless you don't mind poor sound quality with A LOT of bass. The volume is able to get very loud though.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Super Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely comfortable! You can use them for hours without any ear sensitivity. The volume control is top quality! These are a very well made piece and well worth your dollars.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Bad noise and hiss.
customer_reviews.text: Way too much noise and hiss. I know these are cheap but sound quality is exercrable. Got them due to the long cord. Used to be able to buy much cheaper phones of much higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle Dweller

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, great sound, and fit over my big ears
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several kinds/brands of inexpensive PC earphones, but these are the best. Very good sound and descent noise cancelling, but most of all they fit over my big ears. lol
customer_reviews.author: Dtoolman

customer_reviews.title: Sound is not too good
customer_reviews.text: Paid for a new one I got a used pair for the price of new . Sound is not very good. So I thought it would sound better because they're jvc's you should send me a different pair it's not worth it to mail back
customer_reviews.author: Robert Holmberg

customer_reviews.title: Durable, inexpensive and OK sound quality
customer_reviews.text: For $15, this pair of headband is certainly well-built. I get the impression that it will last many many years. The ear pads are comfortable over my ears ( I wear eye-glasses). The sound quality is better than the ear-buds, but worse than the pair of Sony noise-cancelling headband that cost $120+, which is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Liem

customer_reviews.title: Works good. A bit bassy
customer_reviews.text: Works good. A bit bassy, but just download an equalizer for Firefox from addons and it works good. If you are balding you will need a pad on top of your head, because the plactic is non cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: GH

customer_reviews.title: Wireless - good sound - headphones
customer_reviews.text: Accidentally got these headphones thinking they were wireless earbuds - best mistake. My son wears them all the time. He breaks earbuds within a couple of weeks, so far these are still going strong after about 10 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Destined to fail
customer_reviews.text: Meh.. I'm done buying headphones that don't have removable cables. They invariably get pinched and develop intermittent issues. It would of been nice if the cable that came with this was coiled. These are just a couple of things you don't realize until you use these. I will point out that the top of these headphones are not all that comfortable. I'm not sound quality expert so I'll just leave that part out.
customer_reviews.author: QQ

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable
customer_reviews.text: These don't fully cover my ears. Kind of bulky but for the price I cannot complain too much. If you use your headphones constantly these might not be for you. For the price they are great.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Save Up For Better Quality!
customer_reviews.text: JVC normally makes really good products these headphones are not one of them unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Droopy Koz

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price I really can't complain. If you're used to nice speakers/headphones and are expecting these to sound amazing you'll be disappointed. I bought them as a cheap set to take with me so I don't mess up or miss-place my nicer headphones. They seem durable enough an certainly sound better than ear-buds or any small headphones. They are fairly comfortable as well. My only real complaint is that they should have put some sort of padding on the top part. The plastic just sits on your head and it starts feeling hard after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Kbilly

customer_reviews.title: sound pretty good too for that
customer_reviews.text: Used these for a ham radio contest, and they were comfy to wear for long periods of time, sound pretty good too for that, I hope to use them for music soon and see how they sound for that too.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Colombo

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Meet My Expectations
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a few years back to use on my laptop and the specs seemed good and the price was right and I do like most JVC products. Do not buy these for if you plan to use with a laptop. Seems the laptop does not push enough to drive them very well. At full volume I would barely call it listenable in a medium quiet room. I do not have a streo to try them with so I can not say but assume they are better suited for a home audio system with a headphone jack that offers a better output. Even with my phone after adjusting the audio mix was only marginally better.
customer_reviews.author: Whereeaglesnest

customer_reviews.title: I like the long cable
customer_reviews.text: I like the long cable. It makes it easy to plug into my CPU from several feet away and still have enough cable to move around a little bit. The noise isolation is OK for the office. People can still get my attention but it makes it easier to ignore the background noise. The bass response has been underwhelming. I would buy this again for my purposes (cheap office headphones) but you may be disappointed if you're looking for high-performance.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Dalson

customer_reviews.title: Good sound and price. Headband is hard!
customer_reviews.text: Overall, these are nice quality headphones at a great price. The longer cord ,(2.5m), is just the right length for my use without an extension cable. The sound quality is good. I've just used them for TV listening so far. The down sides: The top headband is hard! The headphones weigh a good amount and the band hurt the top of my head. I added padding to resolve this issue. Not a fan of the Y cable set up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: JVC Full Sized Over Ear
customer_reviews.text: These are great headphones use with ham radio and sound is wonderful Long cord and well made great value for the money this is the second pair.. wore out the first ones after 10 years a great buy for head phones
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent head phonoes
customer_reviews.text: My only criticism of these headphones is that they don't allow a lot of outside noise in as per their slightly less expensive cousins. But the sound is rich and excellent. Check them out.
customer_reviews.author: Raisuli the Magnificent

product_meta.title: JVC Full Sized Over Ear Headband Over Ear Full Size Headband Black (HARX330)
product_meta.description: Style:Wired Over Ear High Quality| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThe HA-RX330 is JVC's new high quality full size headphone with extra bass. It comes with large 40mm high quality driver unit and has a sleek black finish.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,588 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
specifications.Best Sellers Rank: #296 in Over-Ear Headphones#735 in Earbud & In-Ear Headphones
